2: Use fresh tap water 
to	fill	the	kettle.	After	it	has	
boiled, let the water cool for 
no more than 30 minutes. 
Don’t	use	artificially	softened	
water or water that has already 
been boiled. If you have to use 
bottled water, you will still need 
to boil it. The water must still 
be hot, otherwise any bacteria 
in the milk powder might not 
be destroyed.
Always put the partially 
cooled boiled water in the 
bottle first.
Be	careful	–	at	70°C,	water	
is still hot enough to scald.
